docs.snippet: Wednesday began with share prices sliding, an apparent product of investors’ concerns about an escalating dispute between the world’s two biggest economies. By day’s end, markets had reversed course.

headline.print_headline: Indexes Rise Even as Trade Fight Between U.S. and China Grows
headline.main: Stocks Rise on Wall Street Even as Trade Fight Between U.S. and China Grows

docs.snippet: The people in prison are the ones who are dumb enough to get caught. The ones we miss are the most cunning.

headline.print_headline: The War on Drugs Breeds Crafty Traffickers
headline.main: The War on Drugs Breeds Crafty Traffickers

docs.snippet: The Trump administration released a list of Chinese goods that it will subject to tariffs, including electronics, iron and steel plates, engines and optical scanners.

headline.print_headline: White House Unveils Tariffs on Over 1,300 Chinese Products
headline.main: White House Unveils Tariffs on 1,300 Chinese Products

docs.snippet: Companies are united around the idea of addressing China’s unfair trade practices, but details of the president’s plan have set off fierce opposition.

headline.print_headline: Industry Giants Register Dissent On Trade Action
headline.main: Looming China Trade Action Divides Industry and Roils Markets

docs.snippet: It was a dark and stormy night. Of that much we can be sure.
As markets seesawed and industries fretted, American officials held out the possibility that tariffs outlined this week might never go into effect.

headline.print_headline: White House Edges Back From Brink of Trade War
headline.main: White House Tries to Tamp Down Trade War Fears as China Retaliates

docs.snippet: “Denuclearization” is a strange term, unique to the Korean Peninsula. But it works for now.

headline.print_headline: The Word That Could Help the World Avoid Nuclear War
headline.main: The Word That Could Help the World Avoid Nuclear War

docs.snippet: What Trump doesn’t know can hurt us — and help China.
Everyone in an area that loses numbers also loses clout and cash — that includes red states like Texas.

headline.print_headline: How Trump’s Citizenship Question May Hurt the G.O.P.
headline.main: How Trump’s Citizenship Question May Hurt the G.O.P.

docs.snippet: Debating for sport used to be tolerated online — but that was before you could argue with everybody, all the time.

headline.main: Why Have We Soured on the ‘Devil’s Advocate’?
